justification: "To measure financial exploitation, we used the 30-item Older Adult Financial Exploitation Measure (OAFEM, Conrad et al., 2010)."

measured_by: Short Form of Financial Exploitation Vulnerability Scale (FEVS-SF)
justification: "…we also administered The Short Form of Financial Exploitation Vulnerability Scale (FEVS-SF, Campbell & Lichtenberg, 2021), a nine-item scale to detect contextual risk of financial exploitation."

measured_by: amount of money shared in Trust Game items
justification: "…we used hypothetical questions from the Trust Game (Berg et al., 1995)… Participants were asked to indicate how much in dollars they would share… We used the amount of money shared with others as an indicator of participants' trust in the other person."

measured_by: acceptance/rejection decisions in Ultimatum Game items
justification: "We included six items from the Ultimatum Game. Each item asks if the participant would accept or reject an offer… The offer in each item varies across the task in terms of fairness…"
"To assess health, we adopted the physical health… subscales from PROMIS global items (Ader, 2007) as measures of physical health…"
"…we adopted the … mental health subscales from PROMIS global items (Ader, 2007) as measures of … mental health."
"…we used the Everyday Cognition Scale (Farias et al., 2008) to measure perceived decline of everyday cognitive abilities…"
"…the Need to Belong Scale (Leary et al., 2013) to measure participants' desire of acceptance and belonging…"

measured_by: Multidimensional Scale of Perceived Social Support (MSPSS)
justification: "…the Multidimensional Scale of Perceived Social Support (Zimet et al., 1988) to measure participants' subjectively assessed social support."

measured_by: Persuadability subscale of the Two-Factor Gullibility Scale
justification: "…the persuadability subscale … from the two-factor Gullibility Scale … to measure participants' propensity to be persuaded…"

measured_by: Insensitivity subscale of the Two-Factor Gullibility Scale
justification: "…insensitivity to untrustworthiness cues subscales from the two-factor Gullibility Scale … to measure … insensitivity to the presence of untrustworthiness cues."

measured_by: Emotion Regulation of Others and Self (EROS)
justification: "We also used the Emotional Regulation of Others and Self … to measure emotion regulation of improving or worsening the feelings of self [and] others."
"…and the Emotion Regulation Questionnaire … to measure emotion reappraisal and suppression."
"…we added … the Cognitive Reflection Test (Frederick, 2005; Thomson & Oppenheimer, 2016) which measures the ability … to resist reporting an intuitive response…"
